intro: Tetratheca erubescens, commonly known as the red-flowered tetras, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its showy, red or orange-red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, woody fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
